questions.text: As the Guardian, what crime did James stop early in the episode?
questions.explanation:
Armored truck robbery.

	Kara didn't think he was trustworthy because he wore a mask. Alex and Kara were debating James and Winn about Guardian's trustworthiness. Alex and Kara still didn't know that James was the Guardian.

questions.text: Mon-El was locked in a cage when he was first shown in the episode. Who were his captors?
questions.explanation:
Cadmus Labs.

	Cadmus is an anti-alien group that was working all season on destroying relationships between Earthlings and aliens. Cadmus is also the group that had Jeremiah Danvers locked up somewhere working for them.

questions.text: Guardian killed a criminal on camera.
questions.explanation:
False.

	There was a copycat dressed as Guardian that killed a criminal, but it wasn't the actual Guardian. Winn wanted to stop once the copycat showed up, but James convinced him that they should go forward and try to catch the copycat.

questions.text: Cadmus had a Hank Henshaw look-a-like working with them. Who was it really?
questions.explanation:
Cyborg Superman.

	At first he told Supergirl that he was the real Hank Henshaw. They started to fight, and then Supergirl used her x-ray vision to see that he was a machine. That's when he revealed his identity to her.

questions.text: Who was the first person that Winn told the Guardian's identity to?
questions.explanation:
Alex.

	She forced it out of him. She told him that she knew many ways to make him tell her, and then he revealed it before she could force any of those ways on him.

questions.text: Who was the leader of Cadmus?
questions.explanation:
Lillian Luthor.

	She was the mother of Lex and Lena. She was played by Brenda Strong. By the end of the episode Supergirl had stopped the most recent Cadmus plan and Lillian was arrested.

questions.text: Who broke Kara and Mon-El out of their cells?
questions.explanation:
Jeremiah Danvers.

	Danvers was Kara's adoptive father on Earth. It was revealed in the first season that Cadmus had him captive, he hadn't died. This was the first time (other than in flashbacks) that he had appeared in the series. He had been their captive for 15 years. He was played by Dean Cain.

questions.text: J'onn J'onzz and Cyborg Superman both wear the face of Hank Henshaw. Was Hank ever a real person?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Hank was the head of the Department of Extranormal Operations. He was injured in a fight when he met J'onn, who had the ability to shape shift. He took over Henshaw's life at Henshaw's request. The cyborg was built out of Henshaw's dead body, and given his appearance again after all of the cybernetics were installed.

questions.text: Who told J'onn that he was turning into a white martian?
questions.explanation:
Megan.

	Her white martian name is M'gann M'orzz. She had given him a blood transfusion earlier in the season. Back on mars her people had made their blood a virus that would change green martians into white martians.

questions.text: Who broke into the Fortress of Solitude?
questions.explanation:
Cyborg Superman.

	He used blood that was stolen from Supergirl to trick the computers into thinking he was of the House of El. The Fortress of Solitude is only supposed to allow Supergirl and Superman into it without being with one of the others.
